fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let p : \tilde {\mathcal {U}} \to \mathcal {U} be a natural model; the presheaf P_p(\mathcal {U}) = \mathchoice {\textstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}{\textstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}{\scriptstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}{\scriptscriptstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}(A \to \mathcal {U}) classifies types in context A \vdash B~\mathsf {tp}. For any representable \Gamma , there is a natural isomorphism between maps \Gamma \to \mathchoice {\textstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}{\textstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}{\scriptstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}{\scriptscriptstyle \sum _{{\mathopen {}\left (A : \mathcal {U}\right )\mathclose {}}}}(A \to \mathcal {U}) and pairs \Gamma \vdash A~\mathsf {tp} and \Gamma .A \vdash B~\mathsf {tp}.
A natural model of type theory on a small category \mathcal {C} is a representable map of presheaves p : \tilde {\mathcal {U}} \to \mathcal {U}.
